title: Great stay!
text: We enjoyed our stay in Hilton Athens. Our room was spacious and clean, the breakfast buffet had quite a lot of variety. Location wise, it is about 10 min walk to Evangelismos metro station, so it's quite convenient too. Thank you Hilton Athens for providing us with an enjoyable stay!

title: Ok for one night
text: Stayed in this hotel as part of our 2 day 1 night tour to Delphi and Meteora organised by key tours. Room was simple, clean and not big. However, the basin in my room was dirty and a little clogged. Was thinking if I should tell the receptionist about it but decided not to since we were only staying for one night. Hotel's dinner and breakfast was decent. This place would be good enough for 1 or 2 nights but I would choose another hotel if I were to stay longer.

title: Try their truffle pasta!
text: We ordered their truffle pasta after reading good reviews about it. It was really delicious! But selling at 19 Euros per plate, I did hope that the portion could be slightly bigger. Still a place to go to you're craving for pasta though.

title: Grilled mushrooms were nice
text: This place was within walking distance from our hotel so we decided to give it a try on our first evening in Santorini. Their grilled mushrooms were delicious, but chicken chop was a bit too charred for my liking.

title: Perfect place to watch sunset
text: Stopped at the Imerovigli bus stop and walked from there to Skaros Rock. We couldn't get to the top as it was during winter time and the winds were very strong. Nonetheless, the view from nearby was just as awesome! It's a good place to watch Santorini's sunset without the crowd. :)

title: Must see!
text: You have to watch the sunset in Oia if you ever visit Santorini! We were there during winter so the crowd wasn't that bad. Was relatively easy to find a good spot to catch the sunset view.

title: Beautiful!
text: We took the local bus to Oia and walked to Amoudi Bay. The walk took quite a while but it was worth it! The view at the bay was really nice, clear waters and amazing views of the rock and buildings above. Worth a visit!

title: Great place to learn about wine making
text: Saw lots of good reviews on this museum so we decided to check this place out. We paid 10 Euros per pax for a tour around their underground museum, which included an audio guide in our preferred language, as well as tasting of 4 of their different wines. We were the first 2 visitors on that day and there weren't anybody else after us for quite a while, so we could walk around the museum and listen to the audio guide at a comfortable pace. We learnt a great deal about the history and about wine making, and enjoyed the wine tasting very much. This place is a value for money indeed!

title: Learn about the Akrotiri
text: This place is worth a visit if you want to learn more about how it was in the past. We couldn't quite imagine how it was used to be like and had to rely on the information board and our imagination.

title: Nice view
text: We decided to visit the Red Beach as I saw its beautiful pictures online. The place was beautiful, but since it was winter, there wasn't many activities to do there except to take pictures. It was still a pleasurable walk from the bus stop to this place.

title: Great view of the Caldera from view
text: This hotel has a great view of the Caldera, which we never got sick of during our 4 nights of stay there. It was so beautiful! Breakfast was basically the same for all mornings, hard boiled eggs, bread with spread provided and yogurt, but was adequate for us. Location wise, it's a 10 min walk from the main town of Fira where you can take the local bus to all the other towns in Santorini. They seem to lack in manpower, but the staff are still helpful when it comes to queries. Would recommend this place if you want affordable stay in Santorini with the amazing Caldera view.

title: Great location, friendly staff
text: Stayed here for 3 nights during our stay in Athens. This apartment has a superb location! Less than 10 min walk to the Akropoli Metro station and attractions like the Acropolis and Acropolis Museum. Lots of cafes and restaurants nearby too. We accidentally broke a wine glass during our stay, but the staff were kind enough to give us a new one without having to pay. They answered our queries very patiently too. Would recommend this place if you want an affordable stay with great location in Athens!

title: Tasty food at affordable price
text: Visited this place after reading so many good reviews of it. Wasn't disappointed! We ordered the tasting menu as recommended by their waitress and enjoyed most of it. It was 10 Euros per pax and we were full by the 5th dish. Would definitely recommend this place!

title: Food was delicious and affordable
text: We ate here once during dinner. Ordered the meat platter and zucchini balls, both of which were yummy! Though I felt the food could be a little less charred. Price was reasonable too. We ordered one of their spirits with honey and cinnamon, which tasted good and was reasonably priced too.

title: Good for souvenirs and food
text: This would be a nice place if you want to get souvenirs and experience Greek food. Lots of shops and cafes around for you to walk around. Just be careful of pickpockets when you're there.

title: Nice place to visit
text: We paid to enter the stadium and learnt a quite a bit about through their audio guides. There was a nice little museum to enter through a tunnel and we even ran around the stadium. Would recommend this place!

title: Magnificent!
text: Not to be missed when you are in Athens. Everything up there looked magnificent. We were there in winter so tickets were half priced. Really worth it!

title: Huge collection of items, a lot of information to take in
text: The Acropolis Museum is a must-visit if you want to know more about its history. Lots of information to take in. Might have to spend half a day there if you were to read everything in detail.

title: Good location, comfortable stay
text: Stayed here for 2 nights during my stay in Athens. Rooms are not that big, but decent enough for us. Location is good, about 15 min walk to Akropoli Metro station. One thing we love about this hotel is their rooftop view! We got to see a superb view of the Acropolis and the town from there. Not to be missed if you book this hotel. :)

title: Nice Place for Seeing Local's Everyday Life
text: We came here for a walk on a Friday night. The lights there were relatively dim but it gets full of life during the night. We saw various groups of people doing mass exercise while listening to music, while the rest were happily strolling around. If you want to experience how it is like hanging around as a local there, this place is worth a visit.

title: Loved their Sausages and Fried Crickets!
text: We came here for dinner as our friend recommended this place for Lao food. We ordered their platter, morning glory, fried crickets and salted egg fried rice. Out of those we ordered, I especially liked their sausage from the platter and fried crickets, something I never would have thought I would eat! There will be a live band playing after 8.30pm as well so it'll be good to hang around there a while. Prices of food are on the higher side, but I would still recommend it!

title: Amazing Experience
text: We had a amazing 2 hour cruise ride with Sa Sa Sunset Cruise. The scenery from the cruise was great, we managed to watch the sunset which was really beautiful, and got to enjoy a glass of free mojito during the ride too. Highly recommended! :)

title: Ok for a Night's Stay
text: We stayed here for a night during our stopover in Vang Vieng. The room had the basic facilities we needed but there were stains on the bed sheet. The walls weren't too clean either. Also, if you're a light sleeper, this place may not suitable for you. People come back late at night and we could hear them clearly from inside our room. Since we were only staying for one night, we were ok with it, but I wouldn't recommend it if you're intending to stay longer.

title: Loved it!
text: We came here on a Monday afternoon and there were quite a number of tourists but not too overwhelming. We were still able to take some decent pictures of the waterfalls without having too many people at the background. There are 3 main tiers of waterfalls in all. All 3 tiers were beautiful but we particularly loved the 2nd one! The 3rd one was the one where people could dive in and take a dip in the pool. Even if you do not want to swim in it, this place is still worth a visit for its beautiful waters. :)

title: Interesting Visit
text: Other than its grand exterior, the interior of the Royal Palace has a lot of interesting artifacts to see. We got to learn quite a lot about the people who lived in the palace previously. A pity that we couldn't take pictures inside though. Would still recommend this place to anyone who visits Luang Prabang.

title: Interesting Experience for us
text: This visit was an interesting one for us as we do not see a lot of such markets back in our country. Compared to their night market, the morning market sells mostly food stuff. This was the place where we did most of our shopping too. It was fun looking around even if you don't wish to buy anything there! :)

title: Interesting Sight for us
text: We woke up early in the morning just so we could witness this special ceremony. We did not buy the sticky rice to put in the monks' alms, but we followed them from the moment they came out of the temple and witnessed other tourists sitting down and giving out sticky rice to them. The whole ceremony will end within one hour or so. It was nice being there to witness the ceremony!

title: As Interesting as their Morning Market
text: Unlike the morning market which sells mostly food stuff, the night market sells both food and items like clothings, magnets, slippers, diaries, and many more. This would be an ideal place to get souvenirs. Many stalls sell similar items but their designs vary. You can bargain for more discount if you buy more from them too. We came here on all 3 nights we stayed in Luang Prabang, so this shows how much we liked walking around here! xD

title: Decent for a night's stay
text: My friend and I stayed here for one night during our transit in Bangkok. We chose to stay here because of its affordable price and that it provided free airport shuttle too. The room was generally clean but the toilet did not smell good and the lights were a little too dim. Still ok for a night's stay but wouldn't recommend it for longer.

title: Great Service from Hotel Staff
text: My friend and I booked this hotel for our stay in Vientiane after reading all the good reviews about it. It did not disappoint! From the changing of their local sim card, to looking for money changer, asking for directions or the booking of taxi, the staff at the counter were always patient with us and were ready to lend a helping hand whenever we needed their help. We were always greeted with smiles whenever we pass by any of their staff. Would recommend this place! Thumbs up!

title: Small but Informative Place
text: The COPE Visitor Centre isn't a big place, you can finish reading most of the information within an hour or so, but it was interesting to read and learn about how this place was set up in the beginning. There were lots of inspirational stories about how people coped with their lives after losing their legs too. Worth a visit if you're in Vientiane! :)

title: Oldest Temple in Vientiane
text: When I visited this temple, I was initially shocked to see a lot of its Buddha statues being destroyed in one way or another. After that I got to know from my friend that this is actually the oldest temple in Vientiane, and hence you can really see its history in all the statues. The temple is quite small, but still nice to visit if you happen to be in Vientiane.

title: Tasty Lao Cuisine!
text: Lao Kitchen was the first place we visited in Vientiane for Lao cuisine, and it didn't disappoint! We ordered their Kaipen, fried mushrooms, fishcake, tom yum soup, laap and sticky rice, all of which were tasty! Prices were reasonable too. Definitely recommended if you want to try delicious Lao food at affordable prices. :)

title: Big Portions of Food
text: We had lunch here during our stay in Vang Vieng and we ordered their banana milkshake, veggie burger and beef stew pie. Both had big portions and we couldn't finish them all. Taste wise was pretty good too. Worth the price!

title: Perfect Stay!
text: My friend and I stayed here for 3 nights during our stay in Luang Prabang. Everything about this hotel was amazing! Shuttle service to and from town was available every half an hour from 9.10am onwards so it's really convenient every time we wanted to head to town. All we had to do was inform them in advance. Hotel staff were always there to lend a helping hand to us. We told them that our room was a little cold and minutes after, they sent in a heater to our room. We asked for directions and they would take out a map to explain to us in detail. Really appreciative of their excellent service! Food in their cafe was great as well. I still miss eating their Pho (noodle soup) for breakfast! Thank you Le Sen Boutique Hotel for making our stay in Luang Prabang an unforgettable one! :)

title: Great Place to View the Sunset
text: This is a great place to climb if you want to have a nice view of Luang Prabang and its sunset. However, do remember to reach there early if you want to catch a better view of the sunset. We reached there at 5 plus and it was already flooded with people trying to take pictures of the sunset. Still a nice place despite the crowd though.

title: Delicious Lao Cuisine
text: We had dinner here during one of our evenings in Luang Prabang. Although on the pricier side, I loved all the food we ordered, especially their pumpkin curry and laap! Would recommend this place if you don't mind paying more for tasty Lao cuisine. ^.^

title: A must-see if you're in Margaret River!
text: We visited this cave during our trip to Margaret River last week. It was around 300 plus steps down to the cave and the surrounding views were really nice. Felt a little scary as some stairs were kinda narrow and steep though. The view was even nicer once we entered the cave! All the lightings inside made the crystals look really pretty. Our guide also told us to spot interesting crystals which resembled certain animals or items. We learnt a lot during the guided tour. Do be warned that the way back up is 10 times more tiring than going down though.. At least for someone like myself who doesn't have stamina.. Haha.. But at least we got to rest in between where there are benches.. It's good to take pictures of the scenery on your way back up too. Overall it was an interesting experience at the cave! :)

title: Interesting horse riding experience along the bush tracks
text: Since my friend and I were beginners, we initially wanted to book their scenic photo tour. However, since all the vacancies for our desired time slot were already taken, they recommended us to go for their country lane tour instead. The group of us took a ride out to the forests with instructors in front and behind us to help us along the way. I got a little scared when my horse started to trot a little in order to catch up with the other horses, but other than that, most of the ride was enjoyable. They also helped to take photographs of us and the horses along the way. Overall it was an interesting horse riding experience!

title: Beautiful Jetty!
text: We spent half a day at the jetty, including swimming in the sea, having breakfast and lunch, and having the jetty ride and underwater observatory tour. The jetty was really pretty and had clear sea water. The jetty ride was slow and allowed many chances for us to take pictures of the beautiful jetty too. The underwater observatory tour was interesting and we learnt quite a lot about the marine species living underwater. Definitely a must visit in Busselton!

title: Interesting winery tour
text: We signed up for their full day winery and brewery tour last Thursday and Jon was our guide cum driver for the day. He was very knowledgeable and a pleasure to talk to. We enjoyed our tour to the various wineries. At the end of the day, Jon even drove us to have a look at the wild kangaroos when some of us mentioned that we haven't had a chance to see them in Australia yet. Great service and would recommend this tour!
place: Full-Day Winery and Brewery Tour in Margaret River with Lunch

title: Best place to see Australian animals
text: We came here as part of our day tour. Had the chance to be up-close with the wombat, kangaroos, koala and took quite a number of photos with them. A pity we couldn't spend more time here as we had to rush off to another place. This place is a must-visit if you have limited time but wanna see all of Australia's well-known animals!

title: Interesting tour of the prison
text: We did the doing time tour and Janine was our guide. She provided us with lots of information about the past of the prison and how convicts spent their day in the prison. She also told us many horror stories of the convicts who lived there last time. Could imagine how it was like based on how she described the details to us. An interesting place to visit if you're at Fremantle!

title: Delicious fish & chips and seafood platter
text: Ordered their Premium Fish & Chips and Seafood Platter to share among the two of us. Both were delicious and seafood was fresh, but their portion of fries was way too much for us to finish. Good for those with big appetites!

title: A little too sweet for our liking
text: We ordered their big breakfast, pancakes and salted caramel donut since it was recommended by many. We found both the pancakes and donut too sweet. Could do with less syrup and sugar. Their big breakfast on the other hand was pretty delicious. The atmosphere there was good though. Nice decorations all around and good for picture taking.

title: Beautiful place!
text: Came here as part of our day tour. Our driver drove us inside and gave us time to walk around and take some nice shots of the desert. There were very interesting formations of the rocks and you will find that some of them resemble certain animals and structures as long as you use your imagination! Overall a fun experience for us!

title: Great for sandboarding
text: If you want to try sandboarding in Western Australia, then this is the place to go to. It was very windy when we got there it was tough to go all the way up though. Beginners need time to figure out how to slide down too. Worth a try if you're interested in sandboarding!

title: Delicious Thai food
text: We decided to try out this restaurant since we were craving for Thai food and this restaurant was near our apartment. We tried their green curry and omelette with chicken, both of which were delicious! Be sure to visit if you happen to be in Margaret River and wanna try out some authentic Thai food!

title: Great location, clean rooms
text: We booked Darby Park Serviced Residences for 3 nights during our stay in Margaret River. Check in was quick and easy. Our room was spacious and clean too. The apartment also has a good location and is easily accessible to many nearby eateries. Satisfied with our stay here! :)

title: Yummy hotpot!
text: My friend and I had dinner here once and we shared a beef hotpot. The portion was quite big and the food was delicious! Service was good and the staff were really friendly too. Definitely recommended!

title: Awesome breakfast and good service
text: We came here once for breakfast and ordered their roasted sweet potato and soaked oats as we wanted something a little different. Both did not disappoint! The sauteed vegetables that came together with the sweet potato were absolutely tasty. Poached eggs were delicious too! The oats went well with the fruits and nuts and was to our liking. Service was good as well. Highly recommended place to breakfast!

title: Fish and chips was average
text: We had their fish and chips for dinner on our first day in Margaret River. Was kinda expecting it to be tasty but the fish only tasted average at its best. They gave huge portions of the chips though. Will try their squid if we were to visit again next time.

title: Great location and helpful staff
text: My friend and I chose to stay in this hotel for our Perth trip because of the good reviews here. It did not disappoint! Firstly, the hotel staff were extremely helpful, whether it's the booking of taxi or asking for directions, you name it and they'll be there to help you. Special thanks to Linda who went the extra mile to assist us so as to ensure that our trip from Perth CBD to Margaret River was a smooth one. The location of the hotel was great too, right in the heart of Perth CBD, easily accessible to many tourist attractions like the Bell Tower, Kings Park and Perth Mint. Rooms wise, we stayed in their petite twin room and we had a bit of trouble opening our big luggages as the space was quite narrow. Other than the small space, everything else was ok, room was clean and had all the basic hotel amenities we required. Considering the price, I would say this hotel is really value for money! :)

title: Educational trip to Botanic Garden
text: The Kings Park & Botanic Garden is a nice place to visit, especially if you are visiting Perth for the first time. The view of the city from the park is really great, and we learnt a great deal about the plants and flowers there when we went for their free Botanic Garden guided tour. Free tours about the park's past and present are also available daily at 12pm. We definitely found our trip to this place a meaningful one!

title: Nice and cosy place, Delicious food
text: My friend and I had dinner in this restaurant once and we ordered their Tori Teppanyaki and Yaki-Niku to share. Both were delicious, in particular the Yaki-Niku. The tenderloin fillet was succulent and went well with my bowl of white rice. The waitress was prompt in filling our cups of tea too. It's a nice little restaurant to dine in if you're craving for Japanese food in Perth CBD! :)

title: Amazing tour around Perth
text: Ji was our assigned chief explorer of the day and we had a great time touring the various places with him! Since our group consisted of a few kids, Ji made sure that the tour was catered to their needs and tried to make it as fun as possible. We had fun feeding and taking photos of the animals in Caversham Wildlife Park in the morning before heading to Homestead Brewery for a nice lunch. Thereafter, it was a 2 hour ride to the Pinnacles where we took many nice pictures. Ji was volunteered to help us take photos and even recommended us different angles where nice photos could be taken. Our "Use Your Imagination!" tour around the Pinnacles was a fun one as he told us to spot different animals based on the shapes of the various limestones there. We then headed to Lancelin Sand Dunes for sandboarding. Thank you Ji for bringing us on such an insightful tour around Perth!

title: Hands-on Bell Ringing was fun!
text: We paid 18 bucks for the entrance fee which included the ringing of the bells. Our guide gave us interesting facts of the bells and the tower. I found the bell ringing experience to be really fun! Couldn't quite understand how to make them ring at first but finally figured it out after much help from the guide. The view from the top of the tower was great too. The other levels in the tower also provided more information about the bells. Overall I would say this was an interesting visit. Be sure to try out the bell ringing if you were to visit this place!

title: Delicious food!
text: We came here to try out their food after reading all the good reviews. We ordered their market fish and pork collar. Both were pretty looking and tasted really good! Ambience there was great too. Though their meals are kinda expensive, it's still worth it to try at least once!
